_88snapshot.description: Snapshot provides information about a storage volume snapshot.
_88snapshot.title: Snapshot

___startTime.description: The time (epoch) at which the request to create the snapshot was submitted.

$eref.description: Fields are additional properties that can be defined for this type.

___volumeSize.description: The size of the volume to which the snapshot belongs.

___volumeID.description: The ID of the volume to which the snapshot belongs.

___encrypted.description: A flag indicating whether or not the snapshot is encrypted.

$eref.description: Opts are additional properties that can be defined for POST requests.

___startTime.description: The time stamp (epoch) when the task started running.

___queueTime.description: The time stamp (epoch) when the task was created.

___user.description: The name of the user that created the task.

___error.description: If the operation returned an error, this is it.

___completeTime.description: The time stamp (epoch) when the task was completed.

_88instanceID.description: InstanceID identifies a host to a remote storage platform.
_88instanceID.title: InstanceID

___driver.description: The name of the driver that created the instance ID.

___formatted.description: A flag indicating whether or not the instance ID has been formatted by an instance inspection.

___metadata.description: Extra information about the instance ID.

___service.description: The name of the service for which the instance ID is valid.

_88instance.description: Instance is additional information about a host, generated using the InstanceID.
_88instance.title: Instance

$eref.description: Fields are additional properties that can be defined for this type.
InstanceID identifies a host to a remote storage platform.
$eref.title: InstanceID

___driver.description: The name of the driver that created the instance ID.

___formatted.description: A flag indicating whether or not the instance ID has been formatted by an instance inspection.

___metadata.description: Extra information about the instance ID.

___service.description: The name of the service for which the instance ID is valid.

___providerName.description: The name of the provider that owns the object.

___region.description: The region from which the object originates.

$eref.description: Volume provides information about a storage volume.
$eref.title: Volume

___networkName.description: The name of the network on which the volume resides.

___availabilityZone.description: The zone for which the volume is available.

___attachmentState.description: Indicates the volume's attachment state - 0=none,1=unknown,2=attached,3=available,4=unavailable. A volume is marked as attached if attached to the instance specified in the requesting API call. A volume that is attached but not to the requesting instance is marked as unavailable.

___id.description: ID is a piece of information that uniquely identifies the volume on the storage platform to which the volume belongs. A volume ID is not guaranteed to be unique across multiple, configured services.

___encrypted.description: A flag indicating whether or not the volume is encrypted.

___name.description: Ignore is a flag that indicates whether the client logic should invoke the GetNextAvailableDeviceName function prior to submitting an AttachVolume request to the server.

___type.description: Type is the type of storage the driver provides: block, nas, object.

$eref.description: Opts are additional properties that can be defined for POST requests.

_88fields.description: Fields are additional properties that can be defined for this type.

A volume is marked as attached if attached to the instance specified in the requesting API call. A volume that is attached but not to the requesting instance is marked as unavailable.

$eref.description: VolumeAttachment provides information about an object attached to a storage volume.
$eref.title: VolumeAttachment

___volumeID.description: The ID of the volume to which the attachment belongs.

___deviceName.description: The name of the device on to which the volume is mounted.

___mountPoint.description: The file system path to which the volume is mounted.

___id.description: ID is a piece of information that uniquely identifies the volume on the storage platform to which the volume belongs. A volume ID is not guaranteed to be unique across multiple, configured services.

___encrypted.description: A flag indicating whether or not the volume is encrypted.

$eref.description: Opts are additional properties that can be defined for POST requests.

___name.description: Ignore is a flag that indicates whether the client logic should invoke the GetNextAvailableDeviceName function prior to submitting an AttachVolume request to the server.

___type.description: Type is the type of storage the driver provides: block, nas, object.

$eref.description: Instance is additional information about a host, generated using the InstanceID.
$eref.title: Instance

___providerName.description: The name of the provider that owns the object.

___region.description: The region from which the object originates.

$eref.description: Opts are additional properties that can be defined for POST requests.

___ignore.description: Ignore is a flag that indicates whether the client logic should invoke the GetNextAvailableDeviceName function prior to submitting an AttachVolume request to the server.

___prefix.description: Prefix is the first part of a device path's value after the "/dev/" portion. For example, the prefix in "/dev/xvda" is "xvd".

___pattern.description: Pattern is the regex to match the part of a device path after the prefix.

___md5checksum.description: The file's MD5 checksum. This can be used to determine if a local copy of the executor needs to be updated.

___lastModified.description: The time the executor was last modified as an epoch.

___size.description: The size of the executor, in bytes.
